title: General
stimulusHtml:
15 points maximum

One point is awarded for every correctly translated segment. Student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Acceptable translations

  • Aeole: Aeolus
    namque: for/certainly/to be sure/since/because/and in fact

  • divum: of (the) gods/divine ones/divinities/deities [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    pater: father/parent
    (atque): and/and also

  • (atque) and/and also
    hominum: of men/humans/people/humankind/man/mankind/human race [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    rex: king/ruler/chief(tan)/leader/tyrant

  • tibi: (to/for) you
    dedit: (has given) gave/(has) granted (has) allowed/(has) bestowed (power) upon

  • et.....et: both/and....and; both...as well as [must connect mulcere and tollere]

  • mulcere: to
    soothe/calm/settle/pacify/ease/charm/control/soften/appease/quiet/restrain/compose
    fluctus: (the) wave(s)/water(s)/stream(s)/flood(s)/swell(s)/sea(s)/tide(s)

  • tollere: (to) lift/raise/stir(up); take up; swell/build (them/it)
    vento: with/by the/a wind/gale/gust/breeze [must be singular]

  • gens: a race/nation/people/tribe/clan
    inimica: hateful/hated; unfriendly/ill-disposed/hostile/inimical; enemy [only as adj.]
    mihi: to/for me; by me [only with "hated"]

  • navigat: sails/(across/over)/is sailing/makes a voyage (through)/navigates/cruises
    Tyrrhenum: Tyrrhenian/Tuscan/Etruscan
    aequor: (surface of the sea) sea/deep/ocean/water(s)

  • portans: carrying/bringing/conveying/bearing/taking [must be nominative participial phrase]
    in: into/to/towards
    Italiam: Italy/Italia

  • Illium: Illium/Ilion/Troy
    victos: (having been) conquered/defeated/overcome/beaten (down)/vanquished
    -que: and
    Penates: Penates/household gods/tutelary gods/family gods

  • incute: strike/instill; produce
    vim: force/power/strength/violence
    (-que): and

  • ventis: into/upon/to/in [dat. with compound verb] OR by/from/with [abl.] (the) winds/gales/gusts/breezes [must be plural]

  • obrue: overwhelm/overturn/cover/flood/inundate/bury/crush/submerge/sink/swamp
    puppes: ships/boats/skiffs; the sterns/poops/decks/poop decks/keels/hulls/vessels/fleet(s)
    (-que): and

  • submersas: (having been) sunk(en)/submerged/drowned/swamped/overwhelmed/covered/flooded/inundated/overturned [must modify puppes]
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

15 points maximum

One point is awarded for every correctly translated segment. Student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Acceptable translations

  • Aeole: Aeolus
    namque: for/certainly/to be sure/since/because/and in fact

  • divum: of (the) gods/divine ones/divinities/deities [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    pater: father/parent
    (atque): and/and also

  • (atque) and/and also
    hominum: of men/humans/people/humankind/man/mankind/human race [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    rex: king/ruler/chief(tan)/leader/tyrant

  • tibi: (to/for) you
    dedit: (has given) gave/(has) granted (has) allowed/(has) bestowed (power) upon

  • et.....et: both/and....and; both...as well as [must connect mulcere and tollere]

  • mulcere: to
    soothe/calm/settle/pacify/ease/charm/control/soften/appease/quiet/restrain/compose
    fluctus: (the) wave(s)/water(s)/stream(s)/flood(s)/swell(s)/sea(s)/tide(s)

  • tollere: (to) lift/raise/stir(up); take up; swell/build (them/it)
    vento: with/by the/a wind/gale/gust/breeze [must be singular]

  • gens: a race/nation/people/tribe/clan
    inimica: hateful/hated; unfriendly/ill-disposed/hostile/inimical; enemy [only as adj.]
    mihi: to/for me; by me [only with "hated"]

  • navigat: sails/(across/over)/is sailing/makes a voyage (through)/navigates/cruises
    Tyrrhenum: Tyrrhenian/Tuscan/Etruscan
    aequor: (surface of the sea) sea/deep/ocean/water(s)

  • portans: carrying/bringing/conveying/bearing/taking [must be nominative participial phrase]
    in: into/to/towards
    Italiam: Italy/Italia

  • Illium: Illium/Ilion/Troy
    victos: (having been) conquered/defeated/overcome/beaten (down)/vanquished
    -que: and
    Penates: Penates/household gods/tutelary gods/family gods

  • incute: strike/instill; produce
    vim: force/power/strength/violence
    (-que): and

  • ventis: into/upon/to/in [dat. with compound verb] OR by/from/with [abl.] (the) winds/gales/gusts/breezes [must be plural]

  • obrue: overwhelm/overturn/cover/flood/inundate/bury/crush/submerge/sink/swamp
    puppes: ships/boats/skiffs; the sterns/poops/decks/poop decks/keels/hulls/vessels/fleet(s)
    (-que): and

  • submersas: (having been) sunk(en)/submerged/drowned/swamped/overwhelmed/covered/flooded/inundated/overturned [must modify puppes]

Student response earns one of the available points.

Acceptable translations

  • Aeole: Aeolus
    namque: for/certainly/to be sure/since/because/and in fact

  • divum: of (the) gods/divine ones/divinities/deities [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    pater: father/parent
    (atque): and/and also

  • (atque) and/and also
    hominum: of men/humans/people/humankind/man/mankind/human race [may also be translated as English possessive plural]
    rex: king/ruler/chief(tan)/leader/tyrant

  • tibi: (to/for) you
    dedit: (has given) gave/(has) granted (has) allowed/(has) bestowed (power) upon

  • et.....et: both/and....and; both...as well as [must connect mulcere and tollere]

  • mulcere: to
    soothe/calm/settle/pacify/ease/charm/control/soften/appease/quiet/restrain/compose
    fluctus: (the) wave(s)/water(s)/stream(s)/flood(s)/swell(s)/sea(s)/tide(s)

  • tollere: (to) lift/raise/stir(up); take up; swell/build (them/it)
    vento: with/by the/a wind/gale/gust/breeze [must be singular]

  • gens: a race/nation/people/tribe/clan
    inimica: hateful/hated; unfriendly/ill-disposed/hostile/inimical; enemy [only as adj.]
    mihi: to/for me; by me [only with "hated"]

  • navigat: sails/(across/over)/is sailing/makes a voyage (through)/navigates/cruises
    Tyrrhenum: Tyrrhenian/Tuscan/Etruscan
    aequor: (surface of the sea) sea/deep/ocean/water(s)

  • portans: carrying/bringing/conveying/bearing/taking [must be nominative participial phrase]
    in: into/to/towards
    Italiam: Italy/Italia

  • Illium: Illium/Ilion/Troy
    victos: (having been) conquered/defeated/overcome/beaten (down)/vanquished
    -que: and
    Penates: Penates/household gods/tutelary gods/family gods

  • incute: strike/instill; produce
    vim: force/power/strength/violence
    (-que): and

  • ventis: into/upon/to/in [dat. with compound verb] OR by/from/with [abl.] (the) winds/gales/gusts/breezes [must be plural]

  • obrue: overwhelm/overturn/cover/flood/inundate/bury/crush/submerge/sink/swamp
    puppes: ships/boats/skiffs; the sterns/poops/decks/poop decks/keels/hulls/vessels/fleet(s)
    (-que): and

  • submersas: (having been) sunk(en)/submerged/drowned/swamped/overwhelmed/covered/flooded/inundated/overturned [must modify puppes]

Student response earns nine of the available points.
